w.t: to look at another with disapproval!
to put color on each other
to look at one thing after another (many things)
to be good to look at
to strike down and almost kill (either person or tree)
to be cooked after stirring up the fire a second time
to revive after being wilted, (v.i.) fainted
to entrust flock to another to pasture,
to seek to know doer of evil (as witch doctors do)
to have witch doctor bewitch another
to make one tell the truth
to make one go back on what he said
to be angry at, because of
to be angry at each other
to be subjected to another's anger
to give too much to swallow at a time
to stretch oneself out on ground
kurambikakw ibiganza - to lay hands on - dedicate
to weary by a long speech or delay
to be wearied by long speech or delay
to catch one who starts to fall
to pour milk down another's throat
aramutse agenda - and then he went
to be skinned by a blow
to get up in such and such a condition
to come to day to give birth
to swell up in welts (when beaten or burned)
to strike another and peel the skin off
to greet (oneself, not sent by another)
to stand at door and cough or call "muraduba"
person who is great, severe, wise
to talk unkindly to each other
to start up in one's sleep
to come all together at call of trouble
one who always disagrees in an "inama"
one who says things he shouldn't when with others
kuranduka umutima - to be startled or dismayed
to pull out by the roots
to pull out at, for, because of
to get left behind as you stare at something
to show the way by means of
to explain fully till all understand
one who tells others of good things
one who tells them where to go to find smothing good
to go strolling about when one should be working
one that likes to go by himself rather than with others
to hurry along (as cows to better pasture, or child stumbling after something he wants)
to go from one thing to another
effect of sleeping badly, "morning after" headache
to keep someone for the night
scar (from cuts made in treating sick person)
stuff in eyes when one wakes up, "sand"
to be pierced by an arrow
to be kept for the night
to work carelessly wanting to quit
to accuse of, before, because of
to be of equal length or height
to let go of each other
to be crooked (e.g. broken bone which has healed wrongly)
to get well after serious illness
to put "medicine" about the kraal to keep away thieves and evil spirits
"medicine" smeared about kraal to keep away thieves and evil spirits
one who keeps police occupied while one sought escapes
to counteract the effects of evil " medicine"
to give someone a heavy load
to be given a heavy load
blood of cow (drawn out to drink)
per on or animal of very nice disposition
evening (when sun is very low but still visible)
kugera ikirenge - walk in footsteps of another
to try to rule or act in another's place
to have too much to do
to answer to a superior when called
to slander a superior (not intentionally but he interprets it that way)
something that surpasses anything else of its kind
to speak without arriving at the point
to rear a child by means of
to carry in tipoy (not sick person)
to cause to carry in tipoy
to act as go-between for a marriage
to make of equal length or height
to be asked for in marriage
speech defect (esp. for s, sh, c)
to not know what to do
to pay in the place of
to deceive another in order to make him give you money
to think over whether a thing is right
to entrust to someone to guard
metal bracelet (esp. of brass or copper)
moment (of finishing or attaining a thing)
to eat at, in, because of
rheum (a certain kind of illness of eyes)
to sing witb (as, with joy, not people)
to be in debt to but refuse to pay
to be caught and unable to extricate oneself
to taste to prove that it's safe for others
one who speaks with senseless repetition of words
to speak evil of the king
to ask for medicine to counteract bewitchment
to get well when others around are dying
to be able to be found when looked for
to look for at, for, because of
to bring new kind of seeds or cattle into the country
to rinse clothes, grain or dishes
to have a lot (may be even a lot of debts or trouble)
to be nice to look at
to look at by, for, by means of
to be seen by means of
gurtyo - like that (variable adj., durtyo, murtyo, bartyo, etc.)

r.w: ku- ruhira (ye) to do the work of another without approval to get weary at, for' kuruhira ubusa - to give birth to a child who dies at once

w.t: to help to rest by taking the load, etc.
younger brother of boy, sister of girl
to send (esp. person rather than message)
to look from side to side trying to see everything
seeing one indistinctly because he went too fast
to surpass (also used to make comparative)
elders and rulers (esp. in regard to their function of helping the poor)
to fight with, by means of
to answer back lots of words to one who reproves you
to abuse one you formerly loved
(amagara Yandyarutse - my strength has left me)
making others think you've done a miracle when it's only a deception
to enforce what one has said
